episodes.description:

The Australian Post-Mormon Community claims the institution engages in deceptive recruitment, amasses staggering wealth through mandatory tithing, and lacks financial transparency. 

The submission details alleged harms, including the abusive missionary system and intrusive private interviews with children and youth. Former members, prepared to offer oral testimony, urge the Victorian government to implement sweeping legal reforms and create a regulatory body to curb the institutional power and abuses.

Discover the story of two Idaho teens, Rachelle Fischer, 15, and Allen Fischer, 13, missing since June 22, 2025, believed to have been abducted by members of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (FLDS). Their mother, Elizabeth Roundy, a former FLDS member with full custody, fears they were taken to fulfill religious obligations tied to Warren Jeffs’ 2022 revelations, which urge followers to “return children to the church.” This Amber Alert case has sparked nationwide concern, with fears of brainwashing and danger. Join us as we explore the details of their disappearance from Monteview, Idaho, the FLDS’s history of polygamy and control, and the ongoing search for these siblings last seen in traditional FLDS clothing. Learn how Elizabeth escaped the FLDS and her desperate plea for her children’s safe return. Stay updated on this developing story and support the effort to bring Rachelle and Allen home.

episodes.title: Self
episodes.description: Self: In his book “No Bad Parts”, Dr, Schwartz reveals that just under the surface of these wounded parts is a Self which cannot be hurt, knows how to heal both internally and externally, and has characteristics which represent the highest and best of what we can become as human beings. He refers to these traits as the 8 C’s of self-leadership, and I would like to touch on each of these today. As we walk through these traits, I will give some examples from my own healing journey to help illustrate how these characteristics can help us heal our relationship with our Self so that we can then have healthier external relationships as well. Remember that the Midlife Revolution is all about small changes, so I’m not asking anyone to absorb and practice all 8 of these at once. My hope is that you will pick one that resonates with you and feels safe to try. Feel free to save and share this episode so that you can come back to it when you’re ready to try the next one.
